byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington and Mary Williams Walsh from Philadelphia.
byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

abstract: Supreme Court rejects Puerto Rico's attempt to allow public utilities to restructure $20 billion in debt, striking down 2014 Puerto Rico law; island, with $72 billion in debt, argues it needs to restructure at least some of debt under bankruptcy law.

headline.print_headline: Justices Reject Puerto Rico Law in Case on Restructuring Debt
headline.main: Supreme Court Rejects Puerto Rico Law in Debt Restructuring Case

snippet: Justice Clarence Thomas, writing for the majority in a 5-to-2 decision, said the law was at odds with the federal bankruptcy code.
lead_paragraph: Justice Clarence Thomas, writing for the majority in a 5-to-2 decision, said the law was at odds with the federal bankruptcy code.
